intro: Briquetia spicata, commonly known as the spikebriquet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Briquetia spicata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid, well-drained soils.
